channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Engineering Workflow Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Engineering Workflow Management

item.title: CVE-2020-4989|2024-08-04T08:22:07.570Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Workflow Management 7.0, 7.0.1, and 7.0.2 and IBM Rational Team Concert 6.0.6 and 6.0.0.1 could allow an authenticated user to obtain sensitive information about build definitions. IBM X-Force ID: 192707.

item.title: CVE-2020-4547|2024-08-04T08:07:48.970Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation products could allow a remote attacker to hijack the clicking action of the victim. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's click actions and possibly launch further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 183315.

item.title: CVE-2020-4546|2024-08-04T08:07:48.891Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Team Server based Applications are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 183314.

item.title: CVE-2020-5031|2024-08-04T08:22:08.917Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation and IBM Engineering products are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 193738.

item.title: CVE-2020-4544|2024-08-04T08:07:49.001Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Jazz Foundation Products could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information when a detailed technical error message is returned in the browser. This information could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 183189.

item.title: CVE-2020-4866|2024-08-04T08:14:58.518Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering products are vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 190742.

item.title: CVE-2024-28793|2024-08-02T00:56:58.064Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Workflow Management 7.0.2 and 7.0.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. Under certain configurations, this vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 286830.

item.title: CVE-2024-28793|2024-05-28T12:00:47.899Z -- ibm -- engineering%20workflow%20management
item.description: IBM Engineering Workflow Management 7.0.2 and 7.0.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. Under certain configurations, this vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 286830.
